intro: Ophrys cyclocheila, commonly known as the cyclocheila orchid, is a species of orchid native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, which includes a specialized lip that mimics the appearance of a female bee, aiding in its pollination strategy. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. Its flowers are usually pale green or brown, with intricate patterns that enhance its mimicry. Ophrys cyclocheila is a rare and protected species, often found in specific microhabitats across southern Europe.
